metadata.dcterms:title: Land Tenure Shapes Black Bear Density and Abundance on a Multi-Use Landscape
metadata.dcterms:creator: Anne Loosen
metadata.dcterms:description:
Data for resource selection function (RSF) and spatially explicit capture recapture (SECR) analyses completed for the manuscript titled "Land Tenure Shapes Black Bear Density and Abundance on a Multi-Use Landscape" published in Ecology and Evolution. For any and all data usages, please cite:
Loosen AE, Morehouse AT, Boyce MS. Land tenure shapes black bear density and abundance on a multi‐use landscape. Ecol Evol. 2018;00:1–17. https://doi.org/10.1002/ece3.4617
metadata.dcterms:subject: Other
metadata.dcterms:isReferencedBy: Loosen AE, Morehouse AT, Boyce MS. Land tenure shapes black bear density and abundance on a multi‐use landscape. Ecol Evol. 2018;00:1–17. https://doi.org/10.1002/ece3.4617 , doi, 10.1002/ece3.4617, https://doi.org/10.1002/ece3.4617
metadata.dcterms:rights: There is a 1-year embargo on using this data (from date of publication + 1 year).
